data.headline: US stock futures slide as hawkish Fed minutes and Middle East tensions drive risk-off sentiment, with energy and gold rallying while tech and retail lag.
bullets: S&P 500, Dow, Nasdaq 100, and Russell 2000 futures down 0.4–0.5% premarket.
Fed minutes signal division and a hawkish stance, dampening hopes for near-term rate cuts.
US-Iran tensions push oil to six-month highs, fueling gains in energy stocks and gold.
Tech sector faces renewed risk-off pressure after Nvidia's recent AI-driven surge.
Walmart drops 3–4% premarket after weak FY2027 EPS guidance misses consensus, weighing on retail and indices.
DoorDash, Deere, Quanta Services, and Etsy rally on strong earnings and deal news.
Carvana, Wayfair, and Stellantis fall in premarket trading on disappointing updates.
